questions.question_text: In search of a system capable of hosting, monitoring compiling. and testing code in an automated way, what can be recommended to the organization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
While options B, C, and D (Ansible, Perl, and Chef) are also powerful tools in their respective domains (configuration management, scripting, and infrastructure automation), they are not primarily designed for the specific requirements mentioned in the question. Jenkins, on the other hand, is a widely adopted solution for automating code hosting, compilation, testing, and monitoring processes.

choices.D: Deploy a root controller to gather a complete network-level view
choices.C: Use OpenFlow to implement and adapt new protocols
choices.B: Use the East-West API to facilitate replication between controllers within a cluster
choices.A: Build direct physical connectivity between different controllers

questions.question_text: An enterprise solution team is performing an analysis of multilayer architecture and multicontroller SDN solutions for multisite deployments. The analysis focuses on the ability to run tasks on any controller via a standardized interface. Which requirement addresses this ability on a multicontroller platform?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
By using the East-West API, tasks can be distributed and executed on any controller within the cluster, providing flexibility and scalability in managing the network. This standardized interface ensures interoperability and allows for the seamless coordination of network policies and configurations across different controllers in a multisite deployment.

Options A, C, and D are not directly related to the ability to run tasks on any controller via a standardized interface. Building direct physical connectivity between controllers (option A) may improve communication but doesn't necessarily address task execution. OpenFlow (option C) is a protocol used for controlling the forwarding plane of network devices, while deploying a root controller (option D) focuses on gathering network-level information but does not specifically address the execution of tasks on any controller.

Therefore, option B is the most appropriate requirement for addressing the ability to run tasks on any controller via a standardized interface in a multicontroller SDN solution.

Selected Answer: B
B is the ans. The East-West API is used to facilitate communication between controllers within a cluster, allowing them to exchange information and synchronize their states.

comments.content: "ability to run tasks on any controller via a standardized interface" - How East-West API will handle that?

questions.question_text: The Company XYZ network is experiencing attacks against their router. Which type of Control Plane Protection must be used on the router to protect all control plane IP traffic that is destined directly for one of the router interfaces?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Control-plane host subinterface. This interface receives all control-plane IP traffic that is directly destined for one of the router interfaces
https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/ios/qos/configuration/guide/ctrl_plane_prot_external_docbase_0900e4b1805eee4e_4container_external_docbase_0900e4b1814dc683.html#wp1124820

Financial and Governance
https://www.avenga.com/magazine/cloud-strategy/

Refer to implementation PLan

The IT team is working on the preparation phase of the implementation approach - "contingency exit strategy steps" fits in here. "C"
What is one topic that should be considered in the Define Strategy step? - Financial model and Governance model fit in here. "D"

This question is theoretically incorrect!

Selected Answer: D
D. Ref exactly this: https://abr.com/implement-cloud-services/#approach

Selected Answer: D
By addressing financial and governance models in the Define Strategy step, the organization can ensure that they have a clear understanding of the financial implications and governance requirements associated with the integration of cloud services. This helps in making informed decisions, setting realistic expectations, and aligning the strategy with the organization's overall goals and objectives.

While due diligence and financial scenarios (option A), innovation and alignment with business according to volume (option B), and contingency exit strategy steps (option C) are important considerations in the overall cloud service integration process, they may not specifically fall under the Define Strategy step. These topics are likely to be covered in subsequent steps of the implementation approach, such as Assess Current State, Plan and Design, and Implement and Transition.

Selected Answer: D
answer should D

B
Align with business should be part of strategy step

comments.content: I will stick with C as we are in the implementation approach

questions.question_text: A product manufacturing organization is integrating cloud services into their IT solution. The IT team is working on the preparation phase of the implementation approach, which includes the Define Strategy step. This step defines the scope of IT, the application, and the service. What is one topic that should be considered in the Define Strategy step?

choices.B: innovate and align with business according to volume

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
When migrating the terminals to TLSv1.2, it is crucial to ensure the application of strong cryptography and security protocols to safeguard sensitive cardholder data. This involves using encryption algorithms and protocols that meet the required security standards.

Additionally, strong encryption should be applied for the transmission of cardholder data across public networks. This means ensuring that the data is encrypted during its transmission to prevent unauthorized access or interception. This requirement helps protect the confidentiality and integrity of cardholder data as it travels over potentially insecure networks.

The other options mentioned, such as ensuring strong cryptography for users with administrative access (option A), protecting user systems against malware (option D), and maintaining an information security policy (option E), are also important considerations for overall security and compliance but may not be directly related to the specific migration of terminals to TLSv1.2 as required by PCI DSS.

Selected Answer: CE
The only 2 answers that match the PCI DSS requirements list.

Selected Answer: CE
C: without doubt. Matches #4 PCI DSS Requirement among the 12 listed in the cert guide.
not D because cert guide #5 PCI DSS requirement mentions "all systems" , here we see "all user systems" 
E : Matches #12 requirement. Cert guide says "for all personnel" so it includes employees and 3rd p.

Selected Answer: AC
A and C according to this
https://www.centurybizsolutions.net/tls-1-2-requirements/

Selected Answer: AB
A and B

comments.content: B is data at rest and C is data in motion
E is for operation to fulfill PCI DSS, you need it either TLS 1.0 or 1.2

discussion.content:
C & E
B is part of C
https://listings.pcisecuritystandards.org/documents/PCI_DSS-QRG-v3_2_1.pdf

choices.D: Protect all user systems against malware and frequently update antivirus software
choices.B: Apply strong cryptography and security protocols to safeguard sensitive cardholder data.
choices.C: Apply strong encryption for transmission of cardholder data across public networks.
choices.A: Ensure that strong cryptography is applied for users who have administrative access through networks
choices.E: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for employees and third parties.

questions.question_text: A banking customer determines that it is operating POS and POI terminals that are noncompliant with PCI DSS requirements, as it is running TLSv1.0. The customer plans to migrate the terminals to TLSv1.2. What are two requirements to complete the migration? (Choose two.)
